import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

data_percentage=[x*100/total_participants for x in data]
columns=['Python','R','SQL','C','C++','Java','Javascript','Julia','Swift','Bash','MATLAB','None','Other']
data_dict={x:y for x,y in zip(columns,data_percentage)}
language_counts=pd.DataFrame(data_dict,index={0})

source.e4b93256:
tick_labels=['Python','R','SQL','C','C++','Java','Javascript','Julia','Swift','Bash','MATLAB','None','Other']
bar_width=0.35
x=np.arange(13)
fig=plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
ax1=fig.add_subplot(111)
ax1.bar(x,data_percentage,bar_width,color='c',align="center",label="World",alpha=0.5)
ax1.bar(x+bar_width,data_percentage_c,bar_width,color='b',align="center",label="China",alpha=0.5)
plt.xticks(x+bar_width/2,tick_labels,family="Times New Roman",weight="normal",size=10)
from matplotlib import ticker
loc=ticker.MultipleLocator(10)
ax1.yaxis.set_major_locator(loc)
for ticklabel in ax1.yaxis.get_ticklabels():
    ticklabel.set_fontsize(10)
ax1.legend(loc='best',fontsize=15)
ax1.set_ylabel("Percentage/%",fontsize=10)
ax1.set_xlabel("Language categories",fontsize=10)
ax1.set_title("Language preference: World vs China",fontsize=15)

source.849310f9:
Compared with the whole community,Chinese kagglers have a greater preference for Python, accounting for **over 90% compared with 84%**.    
Besides, Chinese kagglers **prefer C, C++ and MATLAB** languages while show **less interest in SQL and R languages**. It is also interesting to see Chinese kagglers **pefer Java to Javascript**,which is **contrary** to the taste of the whole kaggle community.
source.b5d9c399: Which languages are most popular among kagglers?
source.f832dfd8: Scikit_learn is the most commonly use framework, accounting for **over 50%**. Tensorflow is the **most popular** framework for neural network, while Keras and PyTorch still take up **a considerable proportion**. For many kagglers, these frameworks are complementary and may be used at the same time. It is worth mentioning that gradient boosting models, such as Xgboost, LightGBM and CatBoost are also very frequently used frameworks.
source.c29da9bd: Consistent with the preference for the algorithm, Chinese kagglers pay **less attention to frameworks other than neural networks**. For example,   scikit-learn enjoys over 50% of preference among the community while only taking up 35% in Chinese kagglers. Interestingly, Pytorch is **most popular  framework** in Chinese kagglers.Its proportion is nearly **twice** that of the whole community.
source.2ab76ffc:
# Introduction
This is my first notebook and I hope it will be helpful for you to get some insights from the dataset.If there is anything wrong, please feel free to point it out and I will correct it.
source.4b4659bf: As a Chinese, it is natural to compare Chinese kagglers' preference with the whole community's preference. The comparison results are as follows.
source.2c82c0bd: It is not surprising that linear model and logistic model account for **over 50 percent** of kaggles' choices. Tree models and gradient boosting machines are also popular choices, accounting for over **40%** and nearly **30%** respectively. Nerual network families, if summed together, are **the most popular ones**. CNN is the most frequently used neural network.
source.7e3810c7: It can be seen from the picture that Chinese kagglers have a **special preference for neural networks** while show less interest in other algorithms such as tree models and gradient boost machines.
source.048b475e: This count includes how many language do kaggles prefer. 'one' means only one language or none. It is reasonable that most kagglers use less than 5 programming languages, account for over **90%** participants. Using two languages seems to be the most popular choice, about **27%**. There are **two users use 12 languages** on a regular basis, maybe they just want to make a joke :)
source.64298e72: It is also provoking to see which is the most popular framework and algorithm。
source.1fd3821b: It is also interesting to see how many languages do kagglers prefer.
source.5d92e76f: It is clear that Python is the most popular programming language. Over **80 percent** kagglers use Python on a regular basis, which is not a    surprise. SQL is the second, over **40 percent**. This is also one of the most commonly used programming languages for data scientists. Other mainstream languages, such as R, C, C++, Java and Javascript, take up about **20%**.
